intro: Matelea ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to reddish in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Matelea ferruginea is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
